title: Accounting Principles Master Course Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic accounting terminology, mathematical computation skills, and fundamental computer literacy
context.additional_context: Personalized learning progression considering learners' individual device environments, with real-time interaction for concept checks and feedback provision

learning_goals: Double-entry accounting system problems can be recorded with 90% accuracy
The components of balance sheets and income statements can be distinguished and explained
Complex accounting problems can be approached through step-by-step solution strategies using cognitive load management techniques
Accounting principles terminology can be used to communicate with at least 80% comprehension
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
